negotiator.parties

Interface NegotiationParty

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractNegotiationParty, AcceptingNegotiationParty, Annealer, ConcederNegotiationParty, ConsensusVotingHumanAgent, CounterOfferHumanNegotiationParty, FeedbackHillClimber, FeedbackMediator, HillClimber, Mediator, MediatorHumanNegotiationParty, RandomCounterOfferNegotiationParty, RandomFiftyFiftyNegotiationParty, RandomFlippingMediator, UINegotiationParty

    public interface NegotiationParty
    Represents a Party or Agent used in negotiation. NegotiationParty will replace Agent as party can be used for bilateral as well as multilateral cases. If you are using a protocol that inherits from Protocol you should also use NegotiationParty and not Agent.

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • chooseAction

        Action chooseAction(java.util.List<java.lang.Class> possibleActions)
        When this class is called, it is expected that the Party chooses one of the actions from the possible action list and returns an instance of the chosen action. This class is only called if this NegotiationParty is in the Protocol.getRoundStructure(List, negotiator.session.Session).
        Parameters:
        possibleActions - List of all actions possible.
        Returns:
        The chosen action

      • receiveMessage

        void receiveMessage(java.lang.Object sender,
                  Action arguments)
        This method is called when an observable action is performed. Observable actions are defined in Protocol.getActionListeners(List)
        Parameters:
        sender - The initiator of the action
        arguments - The action performed

      • getUtility

        double getUtility(Bid bid)
        Gets the agents utility for a given bid.
        Parameters:
        bid - The bid to get the utility of
        Returns:
        the utility that the agent has for the given bid

      • getUtilityWithDiscount

        double getUtilityWithDiscount(Bid bid)
        Gets the agents utility for a given bid, taking into account a discount factor if present.
        Parameters:
        bid - The bid to get the utility of
        Returns:
        the utility that the agent has for the given bid

      • getUtilitySpace

        UtilitySpace getUtilitySpace()
        Gets the agent's utility space.
        Returns:
        the agent's utility space

      • getTimeLine

        Timeline getTimeLine()
        Gets the timeline for this agent.
        Returns:
        The timeline object or null if no timeline object (no time constraints) set

      • getPartyId

        AgentID getPartyId()
        Gets the agent's unique id

        Each agent should contain a (unique) id. This id is used in log files to trace the agent's behavior. For all default implementations, this has either the format "ClassName" if only one such an agent exists (in case of mediator for example) or it has the format "ClassName@HashCode" if multiple agents of the same type can exists. You could also use the random hash used in the agent to identify it (making it easier to reproduce results).

        Returns:
        A uniquely identifying agent id

      • setPartyId

        void setPartyId(AgentID id)
        Sets the agent's unique id

        Each agent should contain a (unique) id. This id is used in log files to trace the agent's behavior. For all default implementations, this has either the format "ClassName" if only one such an agent exists (in case of mediator for example) or it has the format "ClassName@HashCode" if multiple agents of the same type can exists. You could also use the random hash used in the agent to identify it (making it easier to reproduce results).

        Parameters:
        id - The new id for this agent.
